Netizen submissions
I saw some submissions from high school students who wanted to learn about Chinese history. Since I am studying the history of political thought and political philosophy, I have some suggestions for you.

content:
I beg you to differ.
These high school students have their own independent thinking. I, or the friends who submitted the article, just provide my own experience.
The decision is in their hands.
In fact, it is because there are too many people like you who only care about grades and results that there are so many useless people in universities today.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: @CuimaoSheriff Let me talk about my personal conditions. Male, born in 1986, from northern Anhui, Nanjing 211 + Beijing 985, Internet industry, Beijing household registration, worked in many large Internet companies, currently in Alibaba, P8, annual income including stocks totals about 1.7 million, and there is room for further growth in the future. I have a house in Beiyuan, a 120-square-meter three-bedroom apartment, with a 2 million-yuan loan, and a newly purchased Tesla model 3 for transportation. I am 170cm tall and weigh 65kg. My parents are farmers and now live in Nanjing

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: @CuimaoSheriff I am about to retire from my job. My sister is married in Hefei. Both of them are in the government. We have no worries about food and clothing. It is not easy for our parents to raise us. I can barely be considered a Phoenix man. In the past few years, I felt a little inferior and missed a lot of good girls. I felt that I was not worthy of them at that time, but now I am more than enough. Now I have some achievements in my career, especially among my peers. My parents always nag about my personal problems, so I want to give it a try

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
I see many friends below saying that people are not afraid of the new crown, but are afraid of lockdown. This is a lack of understanding of the national conditions and basic situation.
The information that Chinese people receive every day is "One million deaths in the United States" and "So-and-so will have sequelae for life."
So naturally, their anger now is "Anger that the government is not as strict as before" and "No one is doing nucleic acid, no one is taking care of us."
Most people's demands are that they cannot get the government's meticulous protection, that's all.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
The so-called fear of lockdown is also based on the premise that because the government is not in control, people are worried that no one will take care of them, which will lead to a more serious epidemic and thus a lockdown.
It is different from what everyone outside the wall understands.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Hu Xijin is just a person who is ordered to whitewash. He will not say anything that is not good for the Communist Party. You think he cares about you, but in fact he is using his care to continue to protect the Communist Party, that's all.
In fact, Hu Xijin has said more than once that he is fighting a war of public opinion. Everything he says is for the purpose of public opinion war.
That's why he often goes around in circles, sometimes black and sometimes white.
This job is destined to make him completely abandon any personal cognition

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Even in some emergencies, he sometimes starts with some seemingly conscientious words in the tone of "Old Hu", but in the end, the core of his expression is not really concerned or directly pointing out the problem, but just to appease the public and separate the local from the central decision-making, that's all.
I thought this was a truth that everyone understood, but I really didn't expect that there are actually people who are anti-traitors but support Hu Xijin. I was shocked.
